tn.ref: I thought about all this in my mind
tn.text: AT: "I thought very deeply about all this"

tn.ref: They are all in God's hands
tn.text: Here the word "they" refers to "the righteous and wise people" as well as "their deeds."

tn.ref: in God's hands
tn.text: Here the word "hands" refers to power and authority. AT: "under God's control" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: righteous people and wicked
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: the clean and the unclean
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: the one who sacrifices and the one who does not sacrifice
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: As good people ... so also will the sinner
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: the one who swears ... so also will the man who fears to make an oath
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: everything that is done
tn.text: AT: "everything that people do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: one destiny
tn.text: Here the word "destiny" refers to death.

tn.ref: The hearts of human beings are full of evil, and madness is in their hearts
tn.text: Here the word "hearts" refers to the thoughts and emotions. AT: "Human beings are full of evil, and their thoughts are madness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: they go to the dead
tn.text: AT: "they go to the place of the dead" or "they die".

tn.ref: their memory is forgotten
tn.text: AT: "people forget them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: anything done under the sun
tn.text: AT: "anything that people do under the sun" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: eat your bread with joy, and drink your wine with a happy heart
tn.text: These two phrases share similar meanings and emphasize the importance of enjoying the basic activities of life. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: eat your bread with joy
tn.text: AT: "enjoy your food"

tn.ref: drink your wine with a happy heart
tn.text: Here the word "heart" refers to the emotions. AT: "drink your wine joyfully" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Let your clothes be always white and your head anointed with oil
tn.text: Wearing white clothes and anointing one's head with oil were both signs of gladness and celebration.

tn.ref: your head anointed with oil
tn.text: AT: "anoint your head with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Live happily with the wife whom you love
tn.text: One should love the wife he has. AT: "Since you have a wife whom you love, live happily with her"

tn.ref: Whatever your hand finds to do
tn.text: AT: "Whatever you are able to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: there is no work or explanation or knowledge or wisdom
tn.text: AT: "the dead do not work or explain or know or have wisdom"

tn.ref: time and chance affect them all
tn.text: "what happens and when it happens affect them all" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: affect them all
tn.text: Here the words "them all" refer to race, battle, bread, riches, and favor.

tn.ref: like fish ... like birds ... Like animals, human beings
tn.text: Death catches human beings when they do not expect it, just like people catch animals when they do not expect it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: in evil times that suddenly fall on them
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "in bad circumstances that suddenly happen to them" or 2) "by death that suddenly overtakes them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: in the city was found a poor, wise man
tn.text: AT: "in the city, people found a poor, wise man" or "a poor, wise man lived in the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: the poor man's wisdom is despised
tn.text: Since the man was poor, the people did not appreciate the man's wisdom, nor honor him for his wisdom. AT: "people despise the poor man's wisdom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: his words are not heard
tn.text: They people stopped listening to him. AT: "they do not listen to what he says" or "they do not take his advice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: are heard better
tn.text: AT: "are understood better"
